data.title: Checkin@FMI
data.description: Access control system with RFID cards & barcodes. My teammate and I won first prize on HackFMI (FMI Hackathon) after presenting working prototype. The project was funded from the university, so that it could be implemented in students' hall - making the access to the room easier and allowing books to be taken with ease.

data.title: Thanks Mate!
data.description: The project aims to provide a simple way to give appreciation of others who helped you in some way. Using simple photo you can thank others. Tackled the single-sample-problem in face recognition reaching 60% accuracy. We won mentor's award.

data.title: 3D Scanner
data.description: Another HackFMI project: A colleague and I developed functional 3D scanner made by boxes, toy laser, 2 MP camera, etc. Working prototype with total cost $45. We won a mentor award.

data.title: BikeON
data.description: Smart and secure way to park bikes. Designed and implemented working software and hardware prototype with team of 6 people.

data.title: Recipe Guesser
data.description: Simple genetic algorithm that guesses the ingredients of a meal. Final project of AI university course scoring maximum points. I got good understanding of genetic algorithms.
